Test Name: Legionella pneumophila and Other Legionella Species Culture
Specimen Type: Sputum, bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL), tracheal aspirate, lung tissue, pleural fluid
Purpose: To culture and identify Legionella pneumophila and other Legionella species for the accurate diagnosis of Legionnaires' disease.
Equipment: Buffered charcoal yeast extract (BCYE) agar, selective media (e.g., MWY agar), sterile inoculation loops, humidified incubator (35–37 °C), microscopy setup with Gram stain reagents, Legionella latex agglutination test kits, autoclave
